multiplechoiceresponse.label: Which of the following combinations will you not find in an invalid deductive argument? (Choose one)

choicegroup.choice: true premises and a false conclusion
true premises and a true conclusion
false premises and a false conclusion
false premises and a true conclusion
none of the above, for any combination is possible in an invalid argument

div.p: An invalid form can have any combination of truth values for the premises because an invalid form communicates nothing about the relationship of the premises to the conclusion. To test this for yourself, create invalid arguments using each of the combinations in the answer choices.
